alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Somerset, southern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Westover to near Lawsonia to near Tylerton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Marion Station and Westover around 915 PM EDT. West Pocomoke around 925 PM EDT. Pocomoke City around 930 PM EDT. Snow Hill around 940 PM EDT. Parksley around 950 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Horntown, Hallwood, Mappsville, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Saxis, Wallops Island and Temperanceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
